title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for children and adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other vaccines designated for public health. The Secretary will submit a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating vaccines for children and adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other designated vaccines for public health preparedness efforts. The plan will be submitted to specific Senate committees within 6 months of enactment. The Secretary will submit a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating vaccines for children and adults to specific Senate committees. The plan will include considerations for the basis and prioritization of vaccine schedules. By September 30, 2008, the plan must be fully implemented. The Secretary will require manufacturers to provide at least 1 year notice of any vaccine discontinuance or factors affecting vaccine supply. The Secretary will submit ongoing reports detailing progress in implementing the plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating vaccines for children and adults to specific Senate committees. Manufacturers must provide at least 1 year notice of any vaccine discontinuance or factors affecting vaccine supply, with the option to reduce the notification period under certain conditions. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines for the supply. The Secretary will submit reports to specific Senate committees detailing progress in implementing the vaccine supply plan. The reports will include recommendations on extending the vaccine supply period and discussions on the factors influencing the recommendation. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
